|country = [[Philippines]] |coor = {{Coord|14|36|00.62|N|120|59|46.64|E|display=title}} |campus = [[Urban area|Urban]] |former_names = Arellano Law College, Arellano Colleges |free_label = Hymn |free = [[Arellano Hymn]] |sports = [[Badminton]], [[Basketball]], [[Chess]], [[Association football|Football]], [[Tennis]], [[Swimming (sport)|Swimming]], [[Track and field]] and [[Volleyball]] |colors = [[File:AUC colors.svg|25px|link=]] Blue and Maroon |colours = |nickname = [[Arellano Chiefs|AU Chiefs]] |mascot = Chiefs |athletics = [[National Collegiate Athletic Association (Philippines)|NCAA]] [[NCAA Season 86|Season 86]] |affiliations = * Arellano University * Connect Asia Pacific * INP * LAWPHiL Project * [[National Collegiate Athletic Association (Philippines)|NCAA]] * [[National Capital Region Athletic Association|NCRAA]] * [[NCC Philippines|NCC]] |website = {{URL|www.arellano.edu.ph}} |logo = [[File:AUNameLogoMascotChiefs.jpg|center|230px]] |footnotes = }} '''Arellano University''' (''Pamantasang Arellano'' in [[Filipino language|Filipino]] and commonly abbreviated as '''A.U.''') is a [[private university|private]], [[nonsectarian]] [[university]] located in [[Manila]], [[Philippines]], established in 1938 by Florentino Cayco, Sr. as the Arellano Law College which was later known as Arellano Colleges.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/aboutus.php?article_id=15 |title=History |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=10 March 2010}} The university was named after [[Cayetano Arellano]],{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=167&page=13 |title=Q&A with Francisco Paulino Cayco |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=13 October 2010}} the first [[Chief Justice of the Philippines|Chief Justice]] of the [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court]] of the [[Philippines]]Cruz, Isagani A. (2000). Res Gestae: A Brief History of the Supreme Court. Rex Book Store, Manila and the campus of the university was named after [[Juan Sumulong|Juan Marquez-Sumulong]], the head of operations of the opposition during the [[Commonwealth of the Philippines|Philippine Commonwealth]]. The university is composed of several autonomous colleges, schools and institutes, each conferring undergraduate, graduate and postgraduate degrees, and the basic education units. Research at the university is focused on the [[humanity|humanities]] and [[social science]]s, as well as on [[health]] and [[natural science]]s. The athletic teams are the [[Arellano Chiefs]], members of the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association (Philippines)|National Collegiate Athletic Association]] and the [[National Capital Region Athletic Association]]. ==History== [[File:Cayetano arellano PG.jpg|thumb|left|[[Cayetano Arellano]], the first [[Chief Justice of the Philippines|Chief Justice]] of the [[Philippines|Philippine]] [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court]], whom the university was named after.]] [[File:AU Main Building, Manila.jpg|left|thumb|Arellano University at present.]] Arellano University was created through the initiative of Florentino Cayco, Sr., the first Filipino Undersecretary of Public Instruction and an educator. On 1938, he established the Arellano Law College in [[Intramuros]]. The university closed on December 1941 to 1945 because of the [[Japanese occupation of the Philippines|Japanese invasion in the Philippines]] during [[World War II]]. It reopened on April 1945 and was renamed as Arellano Colleges. On June 1946, Cayco became the first [[President of Arellano University]] and through his efforts Arellano Colleges became Arellano University on February 22, 1947. Arellano University moved it site on Plaza Guipit on 1948 before being relocated back to [[Sampaloc, Manila|Sampaloc]]. On 1954, Arellano University opened an institute of nursing and later a law school, followed by the other institutes, and since has expanded into six constituent universities which was named after several [[National hero of the Philippines|national heroes]] of the [[Philippines]] as follows; Andres Bonifacio, Apolinario Mabini, [[Arellano University â Jose Abad Santos Campus|Jose Abad Santos]], [[Arellano University â Elisa Esguerra Campus|Jose Rizal]], Juan MarquezâSumulong, and [[Arellano University â Plaridel Campus|Marcelo H. del Pilar]]. Recent happenings include the fatal death of a 10-year-old pupil from Arellano University in Malabon named Lyzel Angela Santiago who was playing with the swing when she fell to the ground face down just as the swing's frame cracked open her head{{cite web |url=http://rp2.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/metro-manila/11/27/08/arellano-university-pupil-dies-playground-accident |title=Arellano University pupil dies in playground accident |publisher=ABS-CBN News |accessdate=22 September 2011}}{{cite web |url=http://www.gmanews.tv/story/136015/10-year-old-pupil-dies-after-fall-from-swing |title=10-year-old pupil dies after fall from swing |publisher=GMA News Online |accessdate=22 September 2011}} and a nursing student named Katrina Bautista from Arellano University in Pasig when she drowned during their immersion at Ilog Bulo, [[San Miguel, Bulacan|San Miguel]], [[Bulacan]]. Ever since, some parents questioned the safety of the university. Students also questioned the claim of the University that it gives scholarship to students applying at the School of Law with grade average of 85 and above{{cite web |url=http://www.arellanolaw.edu/admis.html#discount |title=Admissions |publisher=Arellano University School of Law |accessdate=4 December 2011}} because when a student would apply for the said [[scholarship]], the faculty evades the issue. Some even citing it is a [[propaganda]] to attract enrollment. The celebration for the [[World Intellectual Property Day]] for 2010 on the [[Philippines]] was held at the university, with Hon. Harry K. Thomas, Jr. delivering the welcome message.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=285&page= |title=World Intellectual Property Day held in AU |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=9 October 2010}} ==Campus== [[File:Arellano University Rizal Hall.jpg|thumb|left|The Rizal Hall.]] The campus lies on an area in [[Manila]] known as the [[University Belt]], the unofficial name of a [[de facto]] sub-district of Manila, and is bounded by Legarda St. to the north and C.M. Aguila St. on the south. Colegio de Santa Catalina lies on the east while an ABE International Business College campus sits on the west. The university transferred into its present location immediately after [[World War II]]. The first structures in the campus were the Rizal Hall, followed by the Florentino Cayco, Sr. Memorial Hall and the Plaridel Hall. Other structures in the campus were the Paulino F. Cayco Hall and the Socio-civic Center, the gymnasium of the university.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/facilities.php?article_id=13 |title=Gymnasium |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=22 December 2010}} The main campus has several residential buildings, as well as the other campuses. The campus contains one sub-campus, the Arellano University Institute of Arts and Sciences. To date, the university has established seven campuses and several extension branches within [[Metro Manila|the Metropolis]]. ==Administration and organization== Arellano University School of Law administration is a big liar on its claim on its official website that it gives scholarship to students with grade average of 85 and above. This is never true. When deserving students would inquire about this, the school office staffs would evade the issue. This program does not exist. This is a cunning propaganda of the school administration to attract new enrollees. Prospective enrollees may check this to current law students of the school. A faculty of approximately 200 professors, lecturers, and instructors serve the university. The university is governed by a Board of Trustees. The [[President of Arellano University]] is the day-to-day administrator of the university, along with the Board of Trustees.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/administration.php?catcat_id=7 |title=About the CEO |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=26 December 2010}} All campuses of Arellano University are under their supervision, while each campus are under their own administrative heads. Being the flagship campus, the university was the seat of administration and was the second oldest constituent university of Arellano University. ==Academics== [[File:Paulino F. Cayco Hall.jpg|thumb|The Paulino F. Cayco Hall, which houses the Information Technology Center, the University Library and the College of Nursing.]] [[File:Arellano U Plaridel Hall.jpg|thumb|The Paulino F. Cayco Hall, Florentino Cayco, Sr. Memorial Hall and Plaridel Hall as seen from the Parking Lot.]] The basic education of the university offers the [[Kâ12 (education)|Kâ12]] levels. The [[Arellano University High School]] is the secondary institution of the university. The secondary institution located within the campus was the [[Arellano University High School|Juan Sumulong High School]]. At present time, new courses were added, these were the Bachelor of Science in Accounting Technology, Radiologic Technology, the Bachelor of Library and Information Science and a diploma in Midwifery, a two-year course.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=361&page= |title=Arellano University offers new courses |date=12 July 2011 |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=2011-07-13 }} The '''[[Arellano University Graduate School]]''', officially as the Florentino Cayco Memorial School of Graduate Studies{{cite web |url=http://findarticles.com/p/news-articles/manila-bulletin/mi_7968/is_2004_June_23/arellano-university/ai_n33747929/ |title=Arellano University |publisher=Manila Bulletin |accessdate=15 October 2010}} was established to administer and coordinate all the graduate programs in the university. It spans several graduate programs and offers more than 20 academic programs, and centers in the fields of Education, Nursing and Business. The '''[[Arellano University School of Law|School of Law]]''' is the main institution of the university specializing in [[legal education]] and was established in 1938.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellanolaw.edu/about.html |title=About AUSL |publisher=Arellano University - School of Law |accessdate=8 October 2010}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=50 |title=Law |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} From an institute, it formed the early beginnings of Arellano University and was the first [[law school]] in the [[Philippines]]. The school was managed by the Arellano Law Foundation, a [[Non-profit organization|non-profit]], [[Non-stock corporation|non-stock]] organization established by alumni and faculty members of the university. It was considered a model institution by the [[Commission on Higher Education (Philippines)|Commission on Higher Education]].{{cite web |url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20090923-226561/6-law-schools-to-be-closed----CHED |title=6 law schools to be closed -- CHED |date=23 September 2009 |publisher=The Philippine Daily Inquirer |accessdate=2010-09-06 |quote=Grads flunked bar in past 10 years }} The school was located at [[Pasay]]. The Arellano University Law Forensic Guild won the debate against [[Ateneo de Davao University]] about the lifting of term limits of elective officials in 2008 on ''[[Square Off]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/anc/10/10/08/arellano-wins-square-cvc-law-debates |title=Arellano wins 'Square Off' CVC Law Debates |date=10 October 2008 |publisher=[[ABS-CBN News Channel]] |accessdate=14 October 2010}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=177&page=12 |title=Arellano debating team wins |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=13 October 2010}} The '''Institute of Accountancy''' is the academic unit of Arellano University that specializes in the process of communicating financial information about a [[business entity]] to users such as [[shareholders]] and [[managers]].{{cite book |title=Financial accounting and reporting |last=Elliot |first=Barry and Elliot |authorlink= |coauthors=Jamie |year=2004 |publisher=[[Prentice Hall]] |location=London |isbn=0273703641 |page=3 |pages= |url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=82B1L70-xrsC&lpg=PP1&dq=Financial%20accounting%20and%20reporting&pg=PA3#v=onepage&q=&f=false |accessdate=}} It offers two courses and one program.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=40 |title=Accountancy |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} The '''[[Arellano University Institute of Allied Medical Services|Institute of Allied Medical Services]]''' is the academic unit of Arellano University that specializes in [[physical therapy]].{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=53 |title=Allied Medical Services |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} The '''Institute of Arts and Sciences''' is the academic unit of Arellano University that specializes in the academic [[discipline]]s, the [[art]]s, [[business]] and [[Public relations|public affairs]]. The Legal Transcription is a 3-month [[Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (Philippines)|Technical Education and Skills Development Authority]] course.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=41 |title=Arts & Sciences |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} The '''School of Business and Commerce''' is the academic unit of Arellano University that educates about legally recognized [[organization]] designed to provide [[Good (economics)|good]]s, [[Service (economics)|services]], or both to [[consumer]]s or tertiary business in exchange for money{{cite book | last = Sullivan | first = arthur | authorlink = Arthur O' Sullivan | coauthors = Steven M. Sheffrin | title = Economics: Principles in action | publisher = Pearson Prentice Hall | year = 2003 | location = Upper Saddle River, New Jersey 07458 | page = 29 | url =http://books.google.com/books?id=vPxAHAAACAAJ&dq=isbn:0130630853&ei=WX-1TJ7BMpe8lATQ4cSgCg&cd=1 | doi = | id = | isbn = 0-13-063085-3}} and specializes in the fields of Management, Marketing, Banking and Finance, Paralegal Studies and General Accounting.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=42 |title=Business & Commerce |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=13 October 2010}} [[Australia]]n-recognized certificate and diploma courses in Business of Connect Asia Pacific is now offered in the [[Philippines]] through the university through distance or external education. Successful completion of qualification could qualify students to any universities affiliated with Connect Asia Pacific.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=315 |title=International Programs |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=15 October 2010}} The '''School of Computer Science''' is the academic unit of Arellano University about the theoretical foundations of [[information]] and [[computation]], and of practical techniques for their implementation and application in [[computer]] systems.{{cite journal|author=Comer, D. E.|coauthors=Gries, D., Mulder, M. C., Tucker, A., Turner, A. J., and Young, P. R.|title=Computing as a discipline|url=http://cs.gmu.edu/cne/pjd/GP/CompDisc.pdf| journal= Communications of the ACM| volume= 32| issue=1 |date= Jan. 1989|doi= 10.1145/63238.63239|quote=Computer science and engineering is the systematic study of algorithmic processes-their theory, analysis, design, efficiency, implementation, and application-that describe and transform information.|pages=9}}{{cite conference|author=Wegner, P.|title=Research paradigms in computer science|booktitle=Proceedings of the 2nd international Conference on Software Engineering |location=San Francisco, California, United States| date=October 13â15, 1976|publisher=IEEE Computer Society Press, Los Alamitos, CA|quote=Computer science is the study of information structures}} With advanced and up-to-date state-of-the-art technology,{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=43 |title=Computer Science |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} the institute is able to compete globally with other technological institutes. The '''[[Arellano University School of Education|School of Education]]''' is the academic unit of Arellano University that is devoted to scholarship in the field of [[education]]. The school conducts review classes for Licensure Examination for Teachers. It was in partnership with Hailida International Kindergarten School located in [[Shenzhen]], [[China]],{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=44 |title=Education |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=15 October 2010}} which serves as a training ground for the students. The '''School of Hospitality and Tourism Management''' is the academic unit of Arellano University about the [[hospitality industry]]. It is the most popular course in the university, next to nursing.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=239&page= |title=HRM Students achieve honors in inter-school contest |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=13 October 2010}} Some courses offered by the institute are [[Technical Education and Skills Development Authority (Philippines)|Technical Education and Skills Development Authority]] accredited courses.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=49 |title=Hospitality and Tourism Management |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} Students can qualify directly to [[London South Bank University]] for bachelor and master's degree programs in tourism and hospitality after the successful of completion of certificate and diploma programs. The '''College of Medical Laboratory Science''' is the academic unit of the university for [[Medicine|medical science]]. It offers two courses, which is TESDA recognized.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=343 |title=Medical Laboratory Science |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=23 May 2011}} The '''College of Nursing''' is the academic unit of Arellano University providing education and training to become a fully qualified [[nurse]]. The School of Nursing grew out of the [[Arellano University Graduate School|Graduate Nurse Program]] which was organized in 1960.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=52 |title=Nursing |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=15 October 2010}} The Bachelor of Science in Nursing course started in 1965 and the first group of graduates took the Board Examination for Nurses in 1970. Nursing students have an option to study with the educational institutions affiliated with Arellano University: [[AldersonâBroaddus College]] and [[Edith Cowan University]]. The partnership between [[AldersonâBroaddus College]] started in 2006, which the students must study the first three years in the university before being transferred to [[AldersonâBroaddus College]] for their last year of study in nursing, which could earn them an American Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/inp/ |title=Arellano University - Alderson-Broaddus College International Nursing Program |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=15 October 2010}} The partnership between [[Edith Cowan University]] and Arellano University allows students to transfer to [[Edith Cowan University]] for their final year of study in nursing, which would earn them an [[Australia]]n Bachelor of Science in Nursing degree within two years. The College of Nursing was listed as one of the lowest performing nursing schools in the [[Philippines]], which was questioned by the university as it was one of the highest performing nursing schools.{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleid=527382 |title=CHED list of poorly performing nursing schools questioned |date=28 November 2009 |publisher=[[The Philippine Star]] |accessdate=15 October 2010}} By this time, the University has 56.6% performance as compared to the National Passing Performance of 41.89% for the last 3 years (2008-2010){{cite web |url=http://www.mb.com.ph/node/260130/feu-ceu-top-nur |title=FEU, CEU top nursing schools |author= Ina Hernando-Malipot |date=1 June 2010 |publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]] |accessdate=15 October 2010}} The '''College of Radiologic Technology''' is the academic unit of the University about the health care profession whose practitioners work in hospitals, clinics, free standing imaging centers, and private offices and studies about performing diagnostic imaging examinations like x-rays, computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, and mammography to produce x-ray images of parts of the human body for use in diagnosing and treatment of diseases.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/institutes.php?article_id=363 |title=Radiologic Technology |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=22 September 2011}} ===Research=== The Department of Research and Publications is the official research department of the university and was headed by Dr. Editha L. Padama.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=299&page=2 |title=Padama presents research paper in two international conferences |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}}{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/administration.php?catcat_id=5 |title=Officers of Non-Academic Departments |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=8 October 2010}} Research projects conducted by the department were funded and under the supervision of [[De La Salle University|DLSU]]-[[Commission on Higher Education (Philippines)|CHED]] Zonal Research Center.{{cite web |url=http://ched-zrc.dlsu.edu.ph/hei/ |title=Member HEIs |publisher=DLSU-CHED-ZRC |accessdate=22 December 2010}} The Philippine Education Quarterly is the [[fact]] and [[opinion]] journal and The Magus is the educational research journal of the university, both of which were published under the Department of Research and Publications. ==Student life== [[File:Arellano U image 11.jpg|thumb|left|The Socio-civic Center, home to the [[Arellano Chiefs|Arellano University Chiefs]].]] [[File:AU Chiefs PEP squad.jpg|thumb|220px|The [[Arellano Chiefs|AU Chiefs]] PEP squad.]] {{main|Arellano University student life and culture}} The [[Arellano Chiefs|Arellano University Chiefs]] (formerly the Flaming Arrows) are the official athletic teams of the university and are members of the [[National Collegiate Athletic Association (Philippines)|National Collegiate Athletic Association]]{{cite web |url=http://sports.inquirer.net/breakingnews/breakingnews/view/20100120-248485/Aguinaldo-College-Arellano-join-NCAA-on-probation |title=Aguinaldo College, Arellano join NCAA on probation |author=Izah Morales |date=20 January 2010 |publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' |accessdate=15 December 2010}} and the [[National Capital Region Athletic Association]]. There were several well-established dance troupe in the university which competes in the yearly inter-branch competition, along with the other branches of Arellano University.{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=181&page=11 |title=AU Plaridel High emerges as dance champion |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=2010-09-06}} Fraternities and sororities had established chapters within the university, along with other well-established organizations. Several organizations recognized by the university were the [[Student Government in the Philippines|Student Council]] and other legally established organizations. The Student Council is the head of operations during school activities, especially activities for High School. There are also several collegiate activities headed by their respective council, and sometimes by the university administrator. ==Notable people== {{main|List of Arellano University people}} Persons affiliated to the university, either as students, faculty members, or administrators, are known as "Arellianites". Persons affiliated to the branches of the university were named after the campus name. Throughout the university's history, faculty, alumni, and former students have played prominent roles in many different fields. Among one of its notable alumni is [[Isko Moreno|Francisco Domagoso]], a former actor and currently the [[Deputy mayor|vice mayor]] of [[Manila]].{{cite news| first=Ricky| last=Lo| title=The Saga of Super Isko| date=3 June 2007| publisher=[[ABS-CBN News and Current Affairs]]| url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/storypage.aspx?StoryId=79453| accessdate=2 September 2008}} Other notable alumni includes [[Higino A. Acala, Sr.]], [[Bayani Agbayani]], [[Joey de Leon]], [[Rodolfo Biazon]] and [[Ted Failon]]. ==Campuses== {{main|Campuses of Arellano University}} The university is located in seven campuses located throughout Metro Manila and adjacent areas as well as several extension branches. There are two former campuses of the university, the original location of AU in Malabon and the FG Calderon High School. {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 5px auto 0 auto;" |- !Campus !Locale !Head !Establishment !Image |- |align=center|Arellano University, Manila |align=right|[[Manila]] |align=right|Victoria D. Trivino{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/administration.php?catcat_id=4 |title=Deans of colleges and heads of schools(academic departments & programs) |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=15 November 2009 }} |align=right|1946 |align=right|[[File:AU Main Building, Manila.jpg|90px|Arellano University in Manila]] |- |align=center|Arellano University Law School |align=right|[[Pasay]] |align=right|Jocelyn D. Cuasay |align=right|1938 |align=right|[[File:AU-SL Pasay.jpg|90px|Arellano University School of Law]] |- |align=center|Arellano University, Pasig |align=right|[[Pasig]] |align=right|Marichu C. Sta.Ana
Sonia B. Sanchez |align=right| |align=right|[[File:AU Pasig.jpg|90px|Arellano University in Pasig]] |- |align=center|Arellano University, Pasay |align=right|[[Pasay]] |align=right|Josephine V. Vera Cruz |align=right|1945 |align=right|[[File:19540 100562306644614 100000725346659 13644 4753040 n.jpg|90px|Arellano University in Pasay]] |- |align=center|Arellano University, Malabon |align=right|[[Malabon]] |align=right|Lourdes G. Mudlong
Loreta N. Genota |align=right|1950 |align=right|[[File:AU Malabon Campus.jpg|90px|Arellano University in Malabon]] |- |align=center|Arellano University, Mandaluyong |align=right|[[Mandaluyong]] |align=right|Rosalinda A. Flores{{cite web |url=http://www.arellano.edu.ph/news.php?article_id=305&page= |title=AU in Mandaluyong City now offers college courses |date=2010-08-10 |month=August |publisher=Arellano University |accessdate=2010-09-06}} |align=right|1950 |align=right|[[File:Arellano Mandaluyong Campus.jpg|90px|Arellano University in Mandaluyong]] |- |} {{-}} ==Citations== ===Notes=== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em|group=note|refs= The campus of Arellano located in [[Intramuros]] was the ''first'' campus of the university, which was later destroyed during the war. The ''original'' campus of Arellano University was located in [[Malabon]], and to accommodate the university population, the offices were transferred into the campus in of Arellano in [[Manila]], which was now housed on a modern four-storey building, much larger than the former building. The School of Law offers two different program that leads to Bachelor of Laws (LL.B). The school was originally located at the campus of Arellano in Manila but was relocated in [[Pasay]]. It was considered by [[Commission on Higher Education (Philippines)|CHED]] as a model school. The law school is one of the best performing law school in the Philippines which always makes it in the Top 10 Law Schools. }} ===Footnotes=== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Portal box|Manila|Philippines|University}} * '''[http://www.arellano.edu.ph/ Arellano University]''' - Official website * [http://www.arellanolaw.edu/ Arellano University - School of Law] - Official website * [http://www.arellano.edu.ph/inp/ Arellano University - International Nursing Program] - Official website :* [http://www.aucn-aaaf.org/ Arellano University College of Nursing Alumni Association of America] - Official website {{Arellano University}} {{NCAAPhilippines}} {{University Belt}} [[Category:Higher education in the Philippines]] [[Category:Arellano University|*]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in the Philippines]] [[Category:1938 establishments]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1938]] [[Category:National Collegiate Athletic Association (Philippines)]] [[bcl:Arellano na Unibersidad]] [[tl:Pamantasang Arellano]]
